items.sentence: I don't think Tom will be fired, at least not this week.

I don't think that this is the best time to talk to Tom.
I don't think that it would be wise to do that with Tom.
I don't think that Tom knows Mary can understand French.
I don't think that Tom is the kind of guy who'd do that.
I don't think that Tom is in the mood to work right now.
I don't think that Tom is going to be a problem anymore.
I don't think that Tom has studied French for very long.
I don't think that Tom has any friends who speak French.
I don't think that Tom and Mary have anything in common.
I don't think Tom knows what time I got home last night.
As far as the eye could see, there was nothing but sand.
You must not insist on going out alone so late at night.
Tom told me that he was afraid that Mary might kill him.
They still don't know who's responsible for Tom's death.
I won't be able to fit all these clothes in my suitcase.

Most dogs like it when you scratch them behind the ears.
I wonder whether or not Tom will be in Boston next year.
I wonder whether Tom will be in Boston next year or not.
You know I'm still planning to join the team, don't you?
Tom dropped a box of test tubes, and most of them broke.
Finish your homework by the time your father comes home.
It makes no difference to me whether you do that or not.

Maybe we'd both feel a little better if we took a break.

Everyone else at the party was a lot drunker than I was.

I wonder why Tom didn't want to go to Australia with me.
I don't think that Tom wants to go to Australia with me.
